lines: Your dad's boss thinks that you are a fine young woman. He would be honored if you would consider attending the company dinner with his son, Matt.
#TELL HIM THAT YOU'LL GET BACK TO HIM
*selectable_if (false) #TELL HIM THAT YOU'LL GET BACK TO HIM
#TELL HIM THAT YOU'LL GET BACK TO HIM

What kind of guy needs his father to make a date for him? You see your father's boss waiting outside the country club where they are staging the affair, with his handsome mustachioed chauffeur. Wait a minute... That's not the
chauffeur, it's Matt! This might be better than you thought.
The boss senses that you are trying to give him the runaround.
#LIE YOUR WAY OUT OF THE EXCUSE, AND ACCEPT THE INVITATION
He doesn't get angry at all. Maybe it is just a coincidence that your dad has to sit on a stool, behind a plant for the company affair.

This was a very open-minded set of choices. You arrive at the country club waiting to meet Dad's boss's son. All of a sudden, this MOVIE STAR walks up to you. Your eyes glaze...your mouth gets dry and you must concentrate very hard to
prevent your tongue from dropping out of your mouth. COULD THIS BE MATT?

Nope. It's some guy who works there parking cars. Matt arrives complete with braces, freckles and a squeaky laugh. As the night goes on, you find out he's not so bad. Dad gets a raise the following week. Now, about the company picnic
Your behavior is rude and insensitive. Your boss reconsiders his earlier positive evaluation of you and begins to wonder about your dad as well. You have caused the family considerable stress.

You must really hate your father. The boss' face becomes red. He takes a handful of high blood pressure medication (hey, just like Dad says). When he calms down, he promises that you will never have a job in his company.
Not only have you soured a potentially lucrative future business contact, but you have messed up the opportunity to date Matt, who is a ruggedly handsome college football star.
